# Order and Cart Management Requirements for shoppingMallAi

## 1. Introduction
Order and Cart Management for shoppingMallAi covers all platform workflows from the point a user selects or saves items for potential purchase through successful order completion, shipping/fulfillment, after-service (returns/exchanges), and exceptional administration or error-handling scenarios. Requirements are expressed in EARS (Easy Approach to Requirements Syntax) format, addressing the complete set of business rules, multi-role permission dynamics, concurrency, edge-case handling, and audit/performance conditions needed for reliable enterprise-scale operation.

User roles for all flows in this process include:
- **customer**: initiates cart activity, pushes through checkout, manages orders, requests returns/service.
- **seller**: fulfills orders, updates product status, oversees shipping/after-service for respective items.
- **administrator**: monitors all transactions, resolves disputes, possesses intervention authority in any step with audit logging.

## 2. Cart Model & Session Handling
### Cart Session Lifecycle
- THE shoppingMallAi platform SHALL support both guest (anonymous) and authenticated user cart sessions, with transition/merge flows on login.
- WHEN a non-authenticated user adds an item to cart, THE system SHALL create a temporary, device/browser-bound cart session expiring no more than 7 days after last cart activity.
- WHEN a guest user logs in, THE system SHALL merge the anonymous cart with the user’s persistent cart using these rules:
  - IF product and variant are duplicated, THEN THE system SHALL use the more recent quantity selection and update.
  - IF a product present in guest cart is unavailable or delisted, THEN THE system SHALL exclude it during merge and notify the user.
- WHEN a user logs out, THE system SHALL persist their cart state for retrieval within 30 days; cart is otherwise expired and archived thereafter.
- WHEN an authenticated user’s session is active on multiple devices or browsers, THE system SHALL maintain cross-device cart state in near real time.
- IF session expiration or cart inconsistency occurs, THEN THE system SHALL purge guest carts, archive authenticated ones, and enforce policy-defined concurrency rules prohibiting simultaneous conflicting cart operations from multiple devices.
- WHERE device/browser cookies are unavailable, THE system SHALL create and securely manage an alternative session identifier to persist cart context.
- WHEN an admin or seller needs to troubleshoot a customer cart issue, THE system SHALL provide cart audit and replay logs on request (access-controlled).

### Cart Concurrency and Integrity
- IF two sessions attempt conflicting updates to the same cart or item, THEN THE system SHALL enforce last-write-wins policy, log the event, and notify the user of conflicting actions.
- THE system SHALL cap anonymous/guest cart size to a platform-defined limit (e.g., 50 items), returning explicit errors on overflow attempts.

### Session Security and Auditability
- WHEN a cart is accessed after inactivity exceeding the security policy limit, THE system SHALL require user re-authentication and verify cart validity against current product/inventory status.
- THE system SHALL log all cart access, change, and merge events with timestamps, device, and user context for compliance audit.

## 3. Cart Item Validations
### Product and Option Eligibility
- WHEN a product is added to cart, THE system SHALL validate inventory, minimum and maximum allowed purchase quantities, user eligibility for restricted items (e.g., age, membership, region), purchase windows, and product status.
- IF requested inventory is lower than carted quantity, THEN THE system SHALL prevent the add or increase and display a detailed out-of-stock error.
- WHEN a coupon, promotion, or automatic discount is applicable, THE system SHALL calculate discounted prices and update cart totals in real time, flagging eligibility per line item.
- WHEN a product in an active cart is subject to price, option, or stock change, THE system SHALL notify user, deactivate affected offer, and force explicit confirmation during checkout.
- WHERE bundled products or variants are used, THE system SHALL validate all bundle components/options for eligibility, independent pricing, and inventory.

### Cart Item Editing, Removal, and Edge Cases
- WHEN a user updates or removes cart item quantities, THE system SHALL enforce legal minimums (as defined by each product), maximums, and bundle integrity (e.g., cannot break mandatory bundles).
- IF a change violates business or legal constraints (e.g., reduction below minimum quantity or addition exceeding per-person purchase cap), THEN THE system SHALL block the update and present a compliance message detailing the error and resolution path.
- WHEN a system error, product de-listing, or ban affects items in user cart, THE system SHALL immediately flag the item, prevent checkout, and trigger an alert to both user and administrator for resolution.

### Item-Level Audit and Admin Interventions
- WHEN an administrator or seller investigates suspicious or failed cart operations, THE system SHALL expose full historical record of cart state changes, reason codes on failures, and user-level action logs for compliance review.

## 4. Order Lifecycle (Create, Modify, Cancel)
### Order Creation and State Transition
- WHEN a customer proceeds from cart to checkout, THE system SHALL validate all cart items, customer eligibility, shipping method, payment means, and order/grand total before order instantiation.
- WHEN order creation is invoked, THE system SHALL lock relevant cart line items, decrement ordered inventory atomically, and generate an unmodifiable order record with a unique global identifier. All time-sensitive coupon/promotions SHALL be re-validated at lock time.
- THE system SHALL allow guest checkout only where business policy explicitly allows; guest orders SHALL be tracked by one-time tokens or verifiable non-member identifiers for order lookup/post-service.

### Order Modification, Cancellation, and Splitting
- WHILE an order remains in the 'created' or 'pending payment' state, THE customer SHALL be able to amend shipping information, apply new payment methods, or cancel the order with no penalty.
- AFTER payment completes, THE customer MAY request modification or cancellation (e.g., changing address, order cancellation) only if fulfillment/shipping initiation has not started; this SHALL require seller or administrator approval, with a locked audit log.
- IF the order is handed to a shipper (status = 'fulfilled'), THEN further modifications are disallowed except as part of defined after-service scenarios.
- WHEN an order contains items from multiple sellers/vendors, THE system SHALL create a parent-child structure in which each sub-order is fulfilled, invoiced, and tracked independently. The parent order reflects aggregate state and exception escalation (e.g., partially canceled/refunded orders). All sub-order transitions SHALL trigger notifications and state synchronization to parent.
- WHEN an admin or seller intervenes in an active order (manual adjustment, forced cancellation), THE system SHALL log all changes, reasons, initiators, and synchronize updates to all relevant parties in real time.

#### Order State Transition Diagram
```mermaid
graph LR
  A["Cart Created"] --> B["Checkout Initiated"]
  B --> C["Order Placed"]
  C --> D["Payment Processing"]
  D -->|"Success"| E["Order Confirmed"]
  D -->|"Failure"| F["Payment Failed"]
  E --> G["Fulfillment Pending"]
  G --> H["Shipped"]
  H --> I["Delivered"]
  E -->|"Customer Cancel"| X["Order Cancelled"]
  F --> X
  G -->|"Cancel Before Ship"| X
  H -->|"Return/AS"| J["After-Service/Return Handling"]
```

## 5. Payment Workflow
### Payment Initiation, Methods, and Validation
- WHEN order confirmation is invoked, THE system SHALL validate order eligibility, start a payment session (committing currency, shipping, coupon, deposit/mileage, partial payment use), and initiate real-time transaction tracking with the selected payment provider.
- THE system SHALL support at minimum card, direct bank transfer, virtual account, and electronic wallet payment methods; payment policy for eligibility and constraints on method selection SHALL be definable per product, seller, and order type.
- IF payment is abandoned, fails, or times out, THEN the corresponding order SHALL remain in the 'pending payment' state until timeout expiry (default: 30 minutes), subject to automatic or user-initiated retry, after which order and associated inventory locks SHALL be released and the user notified of expiration.
- WHERE partial payments or deposits apply (e.g., pre-orders, installments, mileage use), THE system SHALL restrict fulfillment activity to completed payment balance, show outstanding amounts prominently, and prohibit split fulfillment until all terms are satisfied.
- WHEN a payment rollback, refund, or chargeback is signed by a provider, THE system SHALL update the order state to 'payment reverted,' notify all parties, and release held inventory immediately.
- WHEN system detects suspicious payment patterns (multiple failed attempts, fraudulent signals), THE order SHALL be locked, flagged for administrator review, and further activity temporarily suspended until resolved; all such actions SHALL be logged with fraud markers for audit.

### Admin and Audit Controls
- WHEN an administrator or authorized auditor requests, THE payment history, session logs, and transaction status of any order SHALL be retrievable with complete timestamps, provider references, and audit chain.

## 6. Fulfillment, Shipping, and Split Orders
### Fulfillment Workflow and Shipping Options
- WHEN payment is confirmed, THE system SHALL create fulfillment tasks for each seller or warehouse, assigning order references, fulfillment SLAs, and notification triggers.
- WHERE a single order includes goods from multiple vendors or locations, THE system SHALL split into sub-orders for independent fulfillment, shipment, receipt confirmation, and after-service actions, recording all parent/child relationships and updating the parent order state on resolution or exception.
- THE system SHALL permit buyers to select among shipping options (standard, express, local delivery, store pickup) subject to business and product constraints and dynamically calculate delivery estimates.
- WHEN shipped, the system SHALL record carrier, tracking information, expected delivery date, and auto-notify user status changes via preferred channel.
- IF carrier pickup fails or a delivery error occurs, THEN the system SHALL immediately notify both seller and buyer, escalate in-system issue tickets per SLA, and allow admin mediation.

### Delivery and Split Shipment Exceptions
- WHERE order items require staggered fulfillment or are sourced from different stock locations, THE system SHALL handle split or batch deliveries, update user at each step, and synchronize order state on completion.
- IF a seller or admin needs to adjust fulfillment timing (e.g., delay due to supply chain issues), THE system SHALL record all timing shifts, notify affected users, and provide next-step remediation guidance.

#### Split Order & Child Shipping Flow Diagram
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Parent Order"
    P["Order Confirmed"]
    P --> S1["Sub-Order (Seller 1)"]
    P --> S2["Sub-Order (Seller 2)"]
  end
  S1 --> F1["Fulfillment/Ship"]
  S2 --> F2["Fulfillment/Ship"]
  F1 --> R1["Delivered/Return/AS"]
  F2 --> R2["Delivered/Return/AS"]
  R1 --> P
  R2 --> P
```

## 7. After-Service (Returns, Refunds, Repairs, Disputes)
### Customer-Initiated Return, Exchange, and After-Service
- WHEN a customer requests return, exchange, or repair, THE system SHALL require order reference, item(s), reason code, and supporting evidence/documentation (e.g., images for damage claim) as per context.
- THE return/exchange/request window (e.g., 7 days from delivery, or per product policy) SHALL be strictly enforced; expired or ineligible cases SHALL be refused with a detailed message and escalation route.
- WHERE partial returns/exchanges are supported, THE system SHALL only accept and process valid items/quantities, generate pro-rata refund amounts, and update parent/child order statuses upon completion.
- IF return is approved, THEN THE system SHALL generate a return shipping label (where applicable), monitor RMA progress, and guarantee refund within business policy (default: 5 business days) after item inspection and validation.
- WHEN items are lost or damaged in shipment or return, THE responsible user (buyer or seller as per incident) SHALL upload photographic or documentary support, and the system SHALL attach all evidence for admin arbitration.
- IF return/exchange/AS is denied (e.g., misuse, policy violation, expired period), THEN THE system SHALL state denial reason clearly, detail remedial steps, and allow the customer to escalate to administrator for final review.

### Administrator and Seller Interventions
- WHEN seller or admin must intervene in a stale, disputed, or ambiguous after-service claim, THE system SHALL record all communication and resolution actions as part of the case file, securing audit trails and user access as appropriate to privacy and business policy.

#### After-Service Return Workflow Diagram
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Return & After-Service"
    AA["Customer Initiates Return/AS"] --> BB["Upload Reason/Evidence"]
    BB --> CC["System Validates Eligibility/Window"]
    CC -->|"Eligible"| DD["Admin/Seller Review"]
    CC -->|"Ineligible"| EE["Denial & Escalation Option"]
    DD -->|"Approved"| FF["Return Label/Shipment"]
    FF --> GG["Item Inspected"]
    GG -->|"Approved"| HH["Refund/Resolution Complete"]
    GG -->|"Rejected"| II["Dispute/Escalation"]
  end
```

## 8. Business Rules, Performance, Auditability, Security
### Comprehensive Business Rules Table
| Process/Requirement          | customer | seller | administrator |
|-----------------------------|:--------:|:------:|:-------------:|
| Add/edit cart items          |   ✅     |  ❌    |      ✅      |
| Checkout, order creation     |   ✅     |  ❌    |      ✅      |
| Fulfillment (ship goods)     |   ❌     |  ✅    |      ✅      |
| Order modifications         |   ✅     |  ✅    |      ✅      |
| View/track orders           |   ✅     |  ✅    |      ✅      |
| Initiate return/exchange    |   ✅     |  ❌    |      ✅      |
| Approve/reject returns      |   ❌     |  ✅    |      ✅      |
| Admin force modifications   |   ❌     |  ❌    |      ✅      |
| View audit log without limit|   ❌     |  ❌    |      ✅      |
| Cart/order error recovery   |   ✅     |  ✅    |      ✅      |

### Performance and Concurrency
- WHEN any user loads cart, order summary, or fulfillment status, THE system SHALL respond in <2 seconds (p99) under normal platform traffic.
- WHEN an order is submitted, THE system SHALL confirm or return explicit errors within 5 seconds, not counting external provider delays.
- WHERE split or bulk operations are performed (e.g., multi-seller orders, mass shipment, admin batch changes), THE system SHALL update all related states atomically and surface errors immediately or fail the entire transaction.
- THE system SHALL prevent concurrent cart or order modification from conflicting roles/sessions/devices; all concurrent writes are serialized and rolled back on collision with user notification.
- Audit logs must be immutable, timestamped, and accessible per permission matrix above.
- WHEN legal or compliance actions (e.g., fraud, suspicious activity, regulation-driven lock) are triggered, THE system SHALL restrict access to relevant orders, cart, and user data and notify the compliance team.
- THE system SHALL redact all sensitive user or payment data in logs as per policy.

## 9. Error Handling, User-Facing Recovery, and Edge-Case Scenarios
### Error Scenarios from Cart to Delivery
- IF session expires, cart data is corrupted, or user data becomes inconsistent, THEN THE system SHALL trigger re-authentication, attempt state recovery, and flag users for support follow-up.
- IF payment gateway is unavailable at checkout, THEN THE system SHALL place the order in a 'pending payment' state and prompt the user to retry or switch payment options, retaining cart locks for session duration.
- IF item becomes out-of-stock, price/option changes, or legal restriction is updated between cart and checkout (e.g., product recall/ban), THEN THE system SHALL block the affected item(s), require explicit user action, and log the event for all affected parties/roles.
- IF carrier loses or delays delivery, THEN THE system SHALL auto-notify buyer and seller with estimated resolution or escalation pathway, and alert administrator if not resolved in business SLA.
- WHEN user attempts to perform actions outside their permissions (e.g., unauthorized order access, admin-forced edits by non-admins), THE system SHALL deny access, record the attempt, and present actionable errors (with references to support or escalation as needed).
- IF an order or after-service becomes stale due to user/role inaction, THEN THE system SHALL remind relevant parties and escalate to admin if not resolved per timeline.

### Comprehensive Exception and Audit Recovery
- WHEN error rates or anomalies exceed platform thresholds in any process (payment failure rate, split order collision, return fraud), THE system SHALL escalate to administrators, surface actionable metrics, and create real-time incident tracking for all affected workflows.

---
See related requirements and role definitions in the [User Roles and Authentication Guide](./02-user-roles-and-authentication.md), [Core Functional Requirements Specification](./03-core-functional-requirements.md), [Discounts, Payments, and Financial Flows Specification](./06-discounts-payments-and-financial-flows.md), and [Performance, Error Handling, and Usability Specification](./11-performance-error-handling-and-usability.md).

files.content:
# 1. Overview and Scope
shoppingMallAi rewards and incentivizes user participation and frequent purchasing by providing a robust system for discounts, coupon management, and deposit/mileage handling, while ensuring robust payments and fraud prevention. This document comprehensively details business rules and operational flows for these financial features to guarantee precise, repeatable, and secure implementation across all user roles.

# 2. Discount & Coupon Issuance and Redemption

## Coupon and Discount Types
THE platform SHALL support the following types of discounts and coupons: 
- Single-use coupons (once per user per campaign)
- Multi-use coupons (limited or unlimited use per user)
- Time-limited discount events (date range, time-of-day)
- Seller-issued coupons (seller-specific, product/category limited)
- Administrator-issued coupons (platform-wide or targeted)
- Order-level discounts (e.g., 10% off total)
- Product-level discounts (e.g., $X off specific products)

## Issuance Procedures
WHEN administrators or sellers initiate a coupon event, THE system SHALL allow configuration of all the following:
- Start and end date/times
- Eligible roles (customer, seller)
- Eligible products, categories, or order conditions
- Redemption channel (site-wide, mobile only, specific seller)
- Maximum total issuance count and per-user quota
- Minimum purchase amount or other qualifying conditions

## Redemption Rules
WHEN a customer applies a coupon or discount code to an order, THE system SHALL validate the following BEFORE applying:
  - Coupon code authenticity and status
  - Date/time window (active?)
  - User's role/eligibility
  - Channel and product eligibility
  - Minimum spend condition
  - Per-user usage quota
  - Seller participation/opt-in (for seller-issued)
  - Stackability with other offers (set by coupon issuer)

THE system SHALL deduct the correct amount from the order total when all validations pass.

## Post-Redeem Processing
WHEN a coupon is redeemed, THE system SHALL decrement available usage (total, per-user), update status, and log the redemption with: userId, couponId, timestamp, applied orderId, and any special notes.

IF coupon validation fails at any point, THEN THE system SHALL record error details (userId, couponId, attempted order, error code) and return an explicit error to the user.

## Coupon Status Lifecycle
THE system SHALL track all coupons in one of these states: issued, active, suspended, expired, redeemed, revoked, deleted.
WHEN a coupon reaches expiry date, THE system SHALL update status to expired and prevent further redemption.

# 3. Rule-Based Eligibility & Restrictions

## User and Order Eligibility
- WHEN defining a coupon, THE creator SHALL specify eligible user roles (customer, seller, etc.), purchase history requirements, or membership levels.
- WHERE a coupon is target-specific (e.g., first purchase), THE system SHALL prevent redemption by users who do not meet criteria.
- WHEN a user attempts to apply multiple discounts, THE system SHALL enforce stackability rules (yes/no, priority, max discounts per order).
- WHEN a coupon or discount is meant for a specific product/category, THE system SHALL validate inclusion in the user's current order.

## Limitations
- THE system SHALL enforce per-user and global issuance/redeem quotas for all coupons and event discounts.
- IF quota exceeded, THEN THE system SHALL prevent further redemption and inform the user (with code: COUPON_QUOTA_EXCEEDED).
- WHEN users attempt to redeem expired/suspended/revoked coupons, THE system SHALL deny application and return appropriate codes (e.g., COUPON_INVALID, COUPON_EXPIRED, etc.).

# 4. Deposit/Mileage Charging and Use

## Charging (Acquisition)
- WHEN a user completes qualifying transactions, event participation, or receives admin/seller grants, THE system SHALL credit mileage or deposit points to user’s account, logging: userId, source, amount, timestamp, and event context.
- WHEN a customer cancels/refunds an order, THE system SHALL reclaim any bonus mileage/deposit granted from that order.
- THE system SHALL separate mileage earned (non-cash, event-based) and deposits charged (cash-equivalent, can be withdrawn if allowed).

## Usage (Redemption)
- WHEN making eligible purchases, THE system SHALL allow the user to select the amount of deposit/mileage to apply (subject to rules per transaction).
- THE system SHALL validate sufficient balance for requested usage.
- THE system SHALL apply maximum usage constraints per order/product, as defined by admin or event rules.
- AFTER transaction, THE system SHALL deduct the applied amount and log the usage (userId, transactionId, amount, timestamp).
- IF attempted usage exceeds available balance, THEN THE system SHALL reject with code: INSUFFICIENT_BALANCE.

# 5. Payment Validation Procedures

## Core Payment Process
1. User initializes cart checkout, selecting payment method (card, transfer, mobile, 3rd party, split, etc.).
2. System verifies cart contents, discounts/coupons, and available applicable deposits/mileage.
3. User authorizes payment – THE system SHALL tokenize and securely store payment intent/session.
4. THE system SHALL validate payment authorization with external providers (acquiring bank, wallet, etc.), following real-time confirmation (or asynch callback for certain methods).
5. THE system SHALL record successful payment confirmation with: userId, paymentId, method, amount, status, timestamp, and orderId.

## Validation Rules
- WHEN payment is initiated, THE system SHALL check validity (order totals, discounts, coupon stacking, taxes, shipping).
- WHEN payment authorization fails, THEN THE system SHALL present user-friendly code (PAYMENT_FAILED, INVALID_METHOD, FRAUD_SUSPECTED) and record full failure details.
- WHERE refunds or partial cancellations arise, THE system SHALL validate refund/exchange rules (e.g., coupon reversals, deposit returns, pro-rata calculations).
- EVERY financial transaction (including deposits/withdrawals, coupon/mileage applications) SHALL be auditable with unique ids and tamper-evident logs.

# 6. Fraud and Abuse Prevention

## Anti-Abuse Controls
- WHEN issuing or redeeming coupons/mileage, THE system SHALL:
  - Detect duplicate or suspicious account creation/usage patterns
  - Track IP/device fingerprinting for anomalous access
  - Set global and per-user thresholds for redemption/issuance
  - Suspend, revoke, or blacklist accounts based on violation triggers
- THE system SHALL limit coupon grants to certified sellers and administrators only.
- ALL bulk coupon issuances SHALL require justification notes and administrative approval log.

## Real-Time Monitoring
- THE system SHALL log every coupon/deposit/payment event with enough metadata to backtrack for investigation.
- THE system SHALL surface suspicious patterns (rapid redemptions, high refund-to-purchase ratios, known fraud IPs/devices) to administrators for action.

# 7. Business Rules & Best Practices

- All financial events (discount/mileage/payment/refund) SHALL be recorded atomically and consistently.
- System SHALL support audit trails for all financial operations for compliance and dispute resolution.
- Administrators SHALL have dashboards to review, suspend, or revoke coupons, oversee deposit/mileage campaigns, and monitor suspected fraud/abuse.
- System SHALL separate internal accounting (for reporting/compliance) from customer-facing balances and events.

# 8. Performance Expectations

- THE system SHALL process coupon eligibility and apply payment logic instantly (sub-2 seconds for >99% flows, <=5 seconds for complex scenarios or third-party payment provider dependencies).
- User balance and order updates SHALL be atomic and reflect in real time following every transaction event.
- All errors involving user actions (coupon, payment, deposit) SHALL display in real time with actionable codes.

# 9. Error Handling Scenarios

- IF a coupon is invalid, expired, or revoked, THEN THE system SHALL prevent usage and provide a clear user message with error code (COUPON_INVALID, COUPON_EXPIRED, etc.).
- IF user attempts to pay with milage/deposit that is insufficient, THEN THE system SHALL block the transaction with INSUFFICIENT_BALANCE.
- IF payment processor fails or times out, THEN THE system SHALL surface PAYMENT_UNAVAILABLE or PAYMENT_TIMEOUT with clear next steps.
- IF fraud/abuse is detected, THEN THE system SHALL block transactions, trigger admin notification, and log all relevant data for further review.

# 10. Workflow Diagrams

## Coupon Issuance & Redemption (Mermaid)
```mermaid
graph LR
    subgraph "Coupon Issuance"
        A["Admin/Seller Configures Coupon"] --> B["Define Rules & Limits"]
        B --> C["Set Quota/Period/Eligibility"]
        C --> D["Issue Coupon to Users"]
    end
    subgraph "Coupon Redemption"
        E["User Applies Coupon"] --> F["System Validates Rules"]
        F -->|"Valid"| G["Apply Discount/Log Redemption"]
        F -->|"Invalid"| H["Deny/Show Error"]
        G --> I["Decrement Quota/Update Status"]
    end
    D --> E
```

## Payment Processing Flow (Mermaid)
```mermaid
graph LR
    A["User Initiates Checkout"] --> B["System Aggregates Discounts/Coupons"]
    B --> C["User Selects Payment Method"]
    C --> D["System Validates Totals & Eligibility"]
    D --> E["Confirm Payment Intent"]
    E --> F["Validate with Payment Provider"]
    F -->|"Success"| G["Record Payment"]
    F -->|"Fail"| H["Show Error/Abort"]
    G --> I["Update Order, Inventory, User Balances"]
```

# Appendix: Permission Matrix (Outline, Refer to Auth Document for Detail)
| Action                                   | Customer | Seller | Administrator |
|------------------------------------------|----------|--------|---------------|
| Receive/Apply Platform Coupon            | ✅       | ✅     | ✅            |
| Issue Seller Coupon                      | ❌       | ✅     | ✅            |
| Issue Admin Coupon                       | ❌       | ❌     | ✅            |
| Use Deposit/Mileage for Purchases        | ✅       | ✅     | ✅            |
| Approve/Manage Bulk Coupon Campaigns     | ❌       | ❌     | ✅            |
| Monitor/Blacklist for Fraud              | ❌       | ❌     | ✅            |


All requirements above are framed for business logic, user validation, and backend implementation support. Every rule, constraint, and flow diagram is written to ensure clear, testable requirements supporting secure, reliable, and compliant handling of discounts, payments, and financial flows for shoppingMallAi.

files.content:
# Customer Interaction and Community Features Requirements for shoppingMallAi

All community and feedback features on the shoppingMallAi platform—encompassing inquiries, reviews, replies/comments, moderation, and evidence preservation—must be implemented as workflow-driven, auditable, permission-controlled processes. These requirements guarantee robust compliance, legal defensibility, scalable participation, and a safe, fair user environment.

## 1. Inquiry & Review Posting

### 1.1 Overview
Customers are allowed to submit inquiries (about products/orders) and reviews (product or seller feedback) under prescribed business rules, with functional boundaries according to user role, purchase history, and platform policy.

### 1.2 Role Eligibility & Permissions
| Action                           | Customer | Seller | Administrator |
|----------------------------------|:--------:|:------:|:-------------:|
| Post product review              |   ✅     |   ❌   |      ✅       |
| Post inquiry (product/order)     |   ✅     |   ✅   |      ✅       |
| Edit own review/inquiry          |   ✅     |   ✅   |      ✅       |
| Delete own review/inquiry        |   ✅     |   ✅   |      ✅       |
| Respond to inquiry/review        |   ❌     |   ✅   |      ✅       |
| Moderate others' content         |   ❌     |   ❌   |      ✅       |
| Attach evidence to submission    |   ✅     |   ✅   |      ✅       |
| View all reviews/inquiries       |   ✅     |   ✅   |      ✅       |

WHEN a customer completes a purchase, THE platform SHALL allow submission of a review within 30 days post-delivery (per purchase, per product, per customer).

WHEN a customer or seller submits an inquiry, THE platform SHALL require assignment to a product, order, or seller, enforce all field validations (subject, body, evidence, prohibited terms), and record creation timestamp.

WHEN an inquiry or review is submitted, THE system SHALL validate that:
- The customer/seller has permissions and is acting within allowed window and eligibility (e.g., verified purchase, not blacklisted).
- All content fields meet required formats, profanity and spam filters, and length constraints (minimum 10, maximum 2,000 characters for body).
- User accepts or waives privacy information on content publishing (to admins, sellers, or public as configured).

IF a review/inquiry submission fails validation, THEN THE system SHALL present explicit error feedback, referencing the specific failed policy (e.g., duplicate review, prohibited word, window expired).

WHERE evidence is required for submitting a dispute or complaint, THE system SHALL restrict submission until the attachment is provided and validated per [Attachment and File Management Requirements](./09-attachment-and-file-management.md).

### 1.3 Submission Lifecycle
- WHEN a review/inquiry is created, THE system SHALL treat as "pending" if subject to moderation or "published" if auto-approve policy applies.
- WHEN a review/inquiry is deleted by author within the allowed window, THE system SHALL mark as deleted, retain prior content snapshot for minimum required audit period, and update related notifications.
- WHEN a submission is updated (see Edit Tracking), THE system SHALL record a full immutable version as per History & Edit Tracking section.
- WHEN a submission is flagged for violation, THE system SHALL escalate according to Moderation Workflows.

### 1.4 Performance
WHEN a post is submitted, THE system SHALL provide feedback (success or field/error) within 2 seconds for 99% of flows under normal load.

## 2. History & Edit Tracking

- WHEN a user edits a review/inquiry/comment, THE system SHALL create a new version, timestamped, linking to the previous version for immutable auditing (EARS).
- WHEN an administrator audits a submission, THE system SHALL present an exhaustive per-version history with diffs between versions.
- THE system SHALL prevent deletion of edit history by non-admin roles under all circumstances.
- WHEN a user deletes their submission, THE system SHALL preserve a snapshot for at least 30 days or until audit/complaint closure (WHILE related dispute is unresolved, retention period is extended).
- IF edit or version tampering is detected (hash mismatch, out-of-sequence update), THEN THE system SHALL lock the record and alert administrators for investigation.

## 3. Commenting & Replies

- WHEN a seller or administrator responds to an inquiry/review, THE system SHALL thread responses beneath the original submission for contextual clarity.
- WHEN a customer replies to an administrator or seller response, THE system SHALL permit a two-level thread (e.g., original post + 1 reply from each role) but prevent infinite nesting.
- THE system SHALL notify the original author when their submission receives a reply.
- WHEN a user edits or deletes their comment/reply, THE system SHALL update thread presentation ("edited", "deleted") and preserve prior versions for moderation access.
- IF spam, duplicate, or abusive replies are detected, THEN THE system SHALL block further thread additions and alert moderation workflows.
- THE system SHALL limit reply depth to two levels and cap total replies per root post at a configurable maximum (default: 10).

## 4. Moderation Workflows

- WHEN a review/inquiry is subject to auto-moderation policy, THE system SHALL use rules (profanity, banned words, spam signals, suspicious evidence, etc.) to accept, reject, or escalate to manual moderator.
- WHEN a submission is flagged (by users, auto-detect, or system), THE system SHALL queue for administrator moderation within 1 hour.
- WHEN moderation occurs, THE system SHALL require action: approve (publish), reject (hide), request edit/correction, or sanction (ban, caution, block user).
- THE system SHALL notify involved users of moderation outcome and, WHERE content is rejected for policy, SHALL present actionable reasons.
- WHERE legal reporting is required (fraud, harmful content), THE system SHALL preserve the entire submission, evidence, audit log, and resolution history for legal authorities, and restrict further alteration.
- WHEN content is sanctioned, THE system SHALL automatically update eligibility for further posting based on configurable strike/penalty logic.
- WHEN moderation is appealed, THE system SHALL route request to the next level administrator and notify involved parties (decision, rationale, timestamp).
- ALL moderation events SHALL create a tamper-evident audit trail with actor, time, action, and context.

### Moderation Diagram
```mermaid
graph LR
    A["User Submission"] --> B{"Auto-Moderation Pass?"}
    B -->|"Yes"| C["Publish Content"]
    B -->|"No"| D["Queue for Manual Review"]
    D --> E{"Moderator Action"}
    E -->|"Approve"| C
    E -->|"Reject"| F["Notify User/Policy" ]
    E -->|"Sanction"| G["Apply Sanction Flow"]
    G --> H["Restrict User, Log" ]
```

## 5. Evidence Preservation

- WHEN evidence is attached (screenshot, file, image) to a submission, THE system SHALL validate format, size, and perform malware scan before associating it to the post.
- THE system SHALL store all evidence in immutable fashion, linked to the original submission and all edit/deletion/version histories.
- WHEN an administrator or legal authority requests evidence retrieval, THE system SHALL present the asset, metadata, and audit/access log, redacting user personal data per policy.
- THE system SHALL enforce access controls: only administrators may delete evidence files (with audit), customers may delete/retract only their own unmoderated evidence within a grace period, and sellers may attach/retract only evidence associated with their own orders/products.
- IF evidence is missing/corrupted/unavailable when required for dispute or authority, THEN THE system SHALL flag the case for investigation and record the resolution path.
- Retention periods SHALL comply with legal and business policies; if in doubt, preserve for 2 years after resolution/closure.

## 6. Error Scenarios and Recovery

- IF a user attempts unauthorized action (e.g., edit/delete other's content), THEN THE system SHALL deny and log the attempt, locking the submitted content for moderator review if repeated.
- IF system performance SLA (2s/99%) is not met during posting, reply, moderation, or evidence upload, THEN THE system SHALL queue the action and display progress, not blocking UX indefinitely.
- IF evidence (file) upload fails (format, malware, storage error), THEN THE system SHALL prompt the user to correct and prevent submission until resolved.
- WHEN moderation or appeals operate beyond required window (e.g., not processed within 1 hour), THE system SHALL escalate to next administrator tier and notify support.
- WHEN severe violation (harmful/offensive/fraud) is detected, THE system SHALL lock offending content, disable all user posting for the involved account, and escalate for compliance review.

## 7. Performance Requirements

- All submissions, edits, deletions, and moderation actions SHALL be processed and confirmed within 2 seconds for 99% of cases, under standard load.
- Evidence uploads for files up to 5MB SHALL complete processing (scanning, linkage, notification) within 5 seconds.
- Notification of moderation or replies SHALL be delivered within 60 seconds of action.

## 8. References to Related Documents
- [User Roles & Authentication Specification](./02-user-roles-and-authentication.md): Full permissions, auth flows, session definitions
- [Attachment and File Management Requirements](./09-attachment-and-file-management.md): Evidence, file validation, integrity

- [Performance, Error Handling & Usability](./11-performance-error-handling-and-usability.md): Error, UX/response standards

## 9. Glossary (Key Terms)
- **Inquiry**: Customer/seller question about a product or order, visible per role/permissions.
- **Review**: Customer-authored product/service feedback, with rating, text, and optional attachments.
- **Reply/Comment**: Threaded response to inquiry or review, with role/visibility governed by policy.
- **Moderation**: Manual/automated review of community content by administrators, deciding outcome.
- **Evidence**: Digital files attached to support a claim, resolve disputes, or satisfy audit.
- **Snapshot/Version**: Immutable record of any posted/edited/deleted content or evidence, used for audit and legal defense.

All requirements are specified for business purposes only. Technical implementation (API, data schema, DB design) is under developer team control, based on these unambiguous requirements.

# 1. Introduction
The shoppingMallAi service is a next-generation, AI-enabled online shopping mall platform. Central to its competitive advantage is the deep personalization of the shopping experience for each customer, seller, and administrator using AI features such as contextual recommendations, adaptive search, dynamic pricing, real-time fraud detection, and market intelligence analytics.

This document defines all business-facing requirements, removing ambiguity for backend developers and establishing complete testable criteria for business stakeholders.

# 2. User Roles & Personalization Scope
| Role           | Personalization Feature Access                                      |
|----------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Customer       | AI-powered recommendations, personalized product/content search, custom pricing and deals, fraud prevention protections, personalized content flags                       |
| Seller         | Access to analytics (including customer sentiment and recommendation trends), optimized pricing tools, fraud detection notifications, insights for promotion targeting |
| Administrator  | Oversight of all AI-driven features, controls for rule configuration, fraud monitoring dashboards, end-to-end analytics, operational diagnostics                        |

## EARS Role Permissions Examples
- WHEN a customer browses the platform, THE system SHALL provide personalized product recommendations based on their activity and preferences.
- WHEN a seller publishes new inventory, THE system SHALL analyze the product for potential customer matches and provide analytics on expected reach.
- WHEN an administrator accesses analytics dashboards, THE system SHALL display aggregated, anonymized recommendation and personalization trends.

# 3. AI-Powered Recommendations
## Business Requirement Summary
- Personalized product and content recommendations must be generated for every logged-in and guest customer based on browsing, purchase, ratings, reviews, and explicit preference data.
- Sellers require recommendation analytics to adjust offerings and promotions.
- Administrators need visibility into recommendation effectiveness and control over sensitive categories.

### EARS Functional Requirements
- WHEN a customer logs in, THE system SHALL immediately update and display recommendations using their recent history and profile.
- WHEN a customer interacts with products, THE system SHALL continuously refine recommendations in near real-time.
- WHEN a customer navigates to any product page, THE system SHALL display related and complementary product recommendations.
- WHEN a seller lists a new product, THE system SHALL notify interested customers fitting the product profile where notification is enabled.
- WHERE categories have age/region-specific rules, THE system SHALL enforce recommendation exclusions/inclusions according to those business constraints.
- IF a customer has opted out of personalized recommendations, THEN THE system SHALL only present trending or generic products.

### Business Rules
- Product recommendations depend on explicit signals (search, add-to-cart, purchase), implicit signals (views, time spent), and negative feedback (ignore, hide, or mark as irrelevant).
- Trending, seasonal, or promotional content may be prioritized according to marketing rules configurable by administrators.
- Recommendation refresh frequency and acceptability of cold-start logic (for new users) must be defined.

### Error & Edge Cases
- IF the recommendation engine is temporarily unavailable, THEN THE system SHALL display fallback recommendations using recent bestsellers or sponsored ads.
- IF customer activity data is incomplete, THEN THE system SHALL fall back to trending or promotional recommendations with a disclosure of limited personalization.

# 4. Personalized Search
## Business Requirement Summary
- Customers must receive search results tailored by their interaction history, wishlists, ratings, region, and seasonality.
- Sellers use personalized search insights to optimize product listings and visibility.
- Administrators configure, monitor, and audit search personalization logic for fairness and compliance.

### EARS Functional Requirements
- WHEN a customer performs a search, THE system SHALL prioritize, rank, and highlight products most relevant to their individual and cohort profiles.
- WHEN search context is ambiguous, THE system SHALL use behavioral and explicit data to disambiguate (e.g., preferred brands, frequent categories).
- WHERE regulatory policies restrict personal data use, THE system SHALL anonymize or disable search personalization accordingly.
- IF a customer's profile restricts certain products (e.g., age, location), THEN THE system SHALL exclude these from personalized search results.

### Business Rules
- Search result ranking must balance commercial business objectives and relevance while honoring customer privacy and regulatory restrictions.
- Personalization weightings (e.g., recency vs. affinity) must be configurable by administrators.
- Search explanations ("Why these results?") must be available to customers as required by business policy.

### Error & Edge Cases
- IF the AI personalization layer is unresponsive, THEN THE system SHALL return accurate but non-personalized results with disclosure.
- IF privacy consent is revoked, THEN THE system SHALL instantly stop applying personalized search enhancements.

# 5. Fraud Detection & Dynamic Rules
## Business Requirement Summary
- AI fraud detection must monitor transactions, interactions, and seller activity in real-time, flagging risky behavior and enforcing business policies.
- Sellers and administrators use fraud detection analytics to detect anomalies quickly, prevent abuse, and resolve disputes.

### EARS Functional Requirements
- WHEN a customer or seller action matches fraud risk patterns, THE system SHALL immediately flag, block, or review the event according to configured rules.
- WHILE a user is flagged under a fraud investigation, THE system SHALL restrict or monitor sensitive operations (e.g., payments, access to account functions).
- WHERE fraudulent trends are detected on a large scale, THE system SHALL escalate to administrators and initiate platform-wide mitigations.
- IF a fraud alert is false positive, THEN THE system SHALL enable users/sellers to appeal and correct their status.

### Business Rules
- Fraud detection thresholds, rule definitions, and action responses must be governed by clear, adjustable business logic.
- All fraud interventions must clarify actions to affected users and provide a reporting channel.

### Error & Edge Cases
- IF the fraud detection engine is unavailable, THEN THE system SHALL fallback to static rules and notify administrators for manual review.
- IF a fraud block is accidentally triggered, THEN THE system SHALL restore normal access within 1 hour after confirming no violation.

# 6. Price Optimization Logic
## Business Requirement Summary
- Prices are dynamically adjusted based on supply and demand, customer sensitivity, historical pricing, competitor benchmarks, and campaign strategies.
- Sellers receive optimization suggestions and can opt into automated or manual adjustments, governed by administrator-configurable limits.

### EARS Functional Requirements
- WHEN customer demand surges or supply drops, THE system SHALL increase product prices, within pre-approved ranges for each category.
- WHEN inventory is high or promotion is active, THE system SHALL decrease product prices, triggering notifications to opt-in sellers.
- WHERE a seller enrolls in automatic price optimization, THE system SHALL adjust prices hourly according to AI-driven strategy and market data.
- IF a seller challenges an automated price change, THEN THE system SHALL provide the rationale and a reversal pathway.

### Business Rules
- Price optimizations must honor minimum advertised price (MAP), regulatory price caps, and seller-defined boundaries.
- Manual and automated adjustments must be auditable and revertible within 48 hours.

### Error & Edge Cases
- IF market data is stale, THEN THE system SHALL skip non-critical optimizations and notify sellers of possible lag.
- IF a price update fails to apply, THEN THE system SHALL retry within 15 minutes or revert to last-known good value.

# 7. Analytics & Sentiment Analysis
## Business Requirement Summary
- Customers benefit from dynamically surfaced products, promotions, or content based on sentiment-driven ranking and market/trend analytics.
- Sellers use dashboards summarizing customer feedback, market positioning, and sentiment trends to drive campaigns.
- Administrators gain oversight of market health, suspicious activity, and AI-driven patterns in user engagement and satisfaction.

### EARS Functional Requirements
- WHEN new customer feedback or review is posted, THE system SHALL update product and seller sentiment scores in real-time.
- WHEN a seller accesses analytics, THE system SHALL display an aggregated dashboard with product performance, sentiment, and AI trend insights.
- WHERE negative feedback trends emerge, THE system SHALL flag at-risk products or sellers for review and intervention.
- IF analytical scoring anomalies occur, THEN THE system SHALL alert administrators and prompt investigation.

### Business Rules
- Sentiment and analytics scoring must be clear, explainable to all roles, and updated in near real-time.
- Dashboard data must be filterable by date range, product category, region, seller, and promotion.

### Error & Edge Cases
- IF analytics engines are delayed or data is incomplete, THEN THE system SHALL disclose known gaps and show latest available information.

# 8. Business Rules & Error Handling
## Business Rule Table (Role-Wise)
| Requirement Domain     | Customer | Seller | Administrator |
|-----------------------|----------|--------|---------------|
| Personalized Reco.    | ✅       | View analytics | Oversight & config |
| Personalized Search   | ✅       | Optimize listings | Configure fairness |
| Fraud Detection       | Protect/account | Appeal+notify | Monitor+respond  |
| Price Optimization    | Receive | Opt-in/control | Set boundaries   |
| Analytics/Sentiment   | See flags | Use dashboards | Full access       |

- All requirements above must use business logic only, not technical implementation.
- IF AI service outages occur, THEN THE system SHALL fail gracefully with default, informative alternatives, and notifications to administrators.
- All business logic must be configurable by authorized administrators only.

# 9. Performance Requirements
- WHEN a user requests recommendations, search results, price suggestions, or analytics, THE system SHALL respond within 2 seconds in 99% of cases.
- WHILE AI-driven personalization is in operation, THE system SHALL ensure perceived latency in user workflows does not exceed 1.5 seconds at any interactive step.
- IF AI/ML models require retraining, THEN THE system SHALL schedule updates to minimize user impact and preserve data consistency.

# 10. Diagram: AI Personalization Workflow
```mermaid
graph LR
    subgraph "Customer Personalization Workflow"
        A["Customer Login/Browse"] --> B["Collect Context Data"]
        B --> C["Invoke AI Personalization Engines"]
        C --> D["Render Personalized UI Components"]
        D --> E["Track Interactions/Feedback"]
    end
    subgraph "Seller Optimization Cycle"
        F["Seller Lists/Updates Products"] --> G["Analyze Inventory & Demand"]
        G --> H["Receive AI Suggestions/Alerts"]
        H --> I["Manual or Auto Price Decision"]
    end
    subgraph "Admin Oversight"
        J["Monitor AI Analytics & Fraud"] --> K["Adjust Policies/Events"]
    end
    E --> G
    I --> B
    K --> C
```

# End of Document

This document provides business requirements only. All technical implementation decisions belong to developers.

# Attachment and File Management Requirements

## 1. Introduction
Comprehensive requirements for attachment and file management in the shoppingMallAi platform. Defines required business logic, user scenarios, workflows, permissions, error handling, compliance, and lifecycle rules for all asset types (images, documents, evidence, invoices, etc.). Written for backend development teams. All requirements employ EARS (Easy Approach to Requirements Syntax). Scope includes roles (customer, seller, administrator) and all business objects interacting with file workflows.

## 2. Attachment Principles and Objective
Attachments/files are business-critical data enabling:
- Product presentation and catalog asset management
- Legal evidence for transactions, disputes, regulatory compliance
- User-driven interaction (community posts, reviews, inquiries)
- Seller onboarding/verification, compliance fulfillment
- Secure, privacy-aligned information exchange (receipts, contracts, invoices)
Unification across domains is mandatory for platform integrity, audit, and performance. All handling must comply with business, legal, and user-experience standards.

## 3. File Upload and Handling Policies
### Role-based Upload Access
- WHERE a user is a customer, seller, or administrator, THE system SHALL provide secure upload endpoints for each permitted file/attachment type per business rules.
- WHERE file upload is triggered by 3rd-party API or partner system, THE system SHALL apply identical validation and audit policy as for direct uploads.
- WHEN bulk-upload/import occurs (seller mass product asset, admin data import), THE system SHALL apply file-level validation, bulk error reporting, and partial success tracking.

### File Validation and Security
- WHEN a file is uploaded, THE system SHALL validate type (extension, MIME), size, and perform synchronous virus/malware and content scan.
- IF a file fails content scanning, THEN THE system SHALL block the file, record event context, and escalate to relevant roles for review.
- WHEN a file passes all validation, THE system SHALL assign a unique file identifier, extract standard metadata, and store in a secure, segregated tier appropriate to business context.
- WHERE uploads exceed per-user or domain-configured quota, THE system SHALL reject the upload, trigger notification, and provide quota usage status to the user/role.
- WHEN a seller or admin performs a bulk import, THE system SHALL throttle requests above defined concurrency rate and require progress/failure tracking.

### Size, Type, and Special Content Policy
| Attachment Type     | Allowed Extensions      | Max Size (MB)       | Notes                                            |
|--------------------|------------------------|--------------------|--------------------------------------------------|
| Product Image      | jpg, jpeg, png, webp   | 10                 | Primary, thumbnail, variant images                |
| Post/Review Media  | jpg, png, gif, pdf     | 5                  | Community features, reviews, inquiries            |
| Seller Docs        | pdf, docx, xlsx        | 20                 | Business licenses, compliance docs                |
| Transaction Invoice| pdf                    | 5                  | Payment, delivery receipts                        |
| Dispute Evidence   | jpg, png, pdf          | 10                 | Complaints, legal evidence                       |
| External Import    | Defined per API/partner| 50 (default)        | Subject to integration agreements                 |

- WHEN a file exceeds allowable size/type, THE system SHALL immediately reject the upload and inform the user/role via explicit business error code.
- IF upload error occurs due to system capacity, THEN THE system SHALL retry up to N times with escalating delay (configurable), and inform on repeated failures.

### Logging, Monitoring, and Audit
- THE system SHALL maintain immutable audit records for every upload (user, role, time, IP/device, file, domain context, event result, anomaly flag).
- WHERE suspicious or abusive upload patterns are detected (e.g., rapid failures, known bad files), THE system SHALL flag accounts and restrict further upload attempts pending admin intervention.

### Performance and Scalability
- WHEN an upload <10MB is initiated, THE system SHALL fully process validation and commit the file within 3 seconds 99% of business hours.
- WHERE attachment is accessed by customer-facing business processes (catalog, receipt, dispute, contract), THE system SHALL deliver file/image via CDN in <1 second 99% of standard user requests, up to 5,000 concurrent connections.
- WHERE bulk import/export jobs are in progress, THE system SHALL estimate time remaining and offer users/admins real-time monitoring and progress error breakdowns.

## 4. Attachment Types, Roles, and Workflows
| Type                | Purposes                                         | Permitted Roles                | Requires Legal/Audit Flag |
|---------------------|-------------------------------------------------|-------------------------------|--------------------------|
| Product Image       | Catalog, options, variant visuals                | seller, administrator         | No                       |
| Post/Review Media   | Community, UGC, evidence, inquiry                | customer, administrator       | Yes (if evidence)        |
| Seller Doc          | Onboarding, compliance, contracts                | seller, administrator         | Yes                      |
| Transaction Invoice | Receipt, proof, record                           | seller, administrator         | Yes                      |
| Dispute Evidence    | Moderation, legal, arbitration                   | customer, seller, admin       | Always                   |
| API Attachment      | External import/proof (logistics, KYC)           | partner, admin                | Yes                      |

### Domain-specific EARS Use Cases
- WHEN a seller registers a new product, THE system SHALL require at least one valid product image before allowing publication.
- WHEN a customer posts a review with an image, THE system SHALL verify and atomically link media in real time.
- WHERE seller onboarding or renewal is in progress, THE system SHALL prevent process completion if any required compliance attachment is missing or invalid.
- WHEN an admin reviews a dispute or order issue, THE system SHALL present every associated evidence file in an unalterable history pane.
- WHERE a compliance deletion/withdrawal request is processed, THE system SHALL anonymize and/or purge attachments subject to retention/legal hold bracketing.

## 5. Metadata, Ownership, and Access Control
### Metadata Assignment
THE system SHALL assign to each file:
- Uploader role (customer, seller, admin, partner)
- Unique user ID
- File type, extension, original name, business domain
- Content hash/checksum
- Upload and last-access timestamps
- Associated entity reference (product, order, user, ticket, etc.)
- Legal/audit/sensitivity flags if mandated by process

### Ownership, Delegation, and Access
- WHEN user attempts to access a file, THE system SHALL check context-based ACL (Access Control List) using role, business object, and file sensitivity flag.
- WHERE attachment is sensitive/private, THE system SHALL restrict access to issuer, authorized administrator, or named delegate(s). All access events are logged.
- IF a non-permitted party requests access to a restricted attachment, THEN THE system SHALL deny access, log the event, and provide business-explained error.
- WHEN a guest user or expired account requests file access, THE system SHALL respond with "resource unavailable" and mask all identifying metadata.
- WHERE group/shared access is permitted (e.g., multi-seller order, arbitration), THE system SHALL dynamically update permitted roles upon resolution updates.
- IF a user is legally entitled to data deletion (e.g., after GDPR Right to Erasure request), THEN THE system SHALL anonymize or destroy attachments after retention period or legal clearance, logging all actions.

### Visibility and Retention
- WHILE disputes, reviews, or onboarding is pending, THE system SHALL enforce evidence/file masking for all unauthorized parties.
- IF file access status changes (resolved, legal/unlock), THEN THE system SHALL update visibility and notify stakeholders by secure event feed.

## 6. Versioning, History, and Audit Trail
- WHEN a file is overwritten or replaced, THE system SHALL preserve all previous versions, marking only the latest as active and flagging any as evidence when required.
- THE system SHALL provide immutable audit trail for all order/dispute/contract attachments, including every access, edit, or deletion event.
- WHERE files are part of legal or compliance process, THE system SHALL lock record from deletion (except admin-initiated or court-ordered) and preserve chain-of-custody.
- IF file version rollback is triggered by authorized user, THEN THE system SHALL record rationale and apply only upon secondary admin confirmation.
- WHERE evidence/audit files are required for more than X years by law, THE system SHALL not delete or anonymize until expiration is validated and legal hold is removed by governance contact.

## 7. File Delivery, CDN, and Retention Management
- THE system SHALL route all public/document assets through CDN, with regional edge caching per service policy.
- WHEN a file's business/core retention period ends (e.g., 24 months post-order closure), THE system SHALL flag as "expired" and initiate archival or deletion per policy; files under legal hold are exempted.
- WHERE external retention is contractually required (API partner, logistics, seller agreement), THE system SHALL synchronize retention timetable and embargo with upstream provider.
- WHEN CDN or storage edge nodes are unavailable, THE system SHALL queue all access/delivery attempts for retry, and proactively escalate extended outages to platform administration.

## 8. Error Handling and Disaster Scenarios
### Error/Incident Handling (EARS)
- IF a file is missing, corrupted, or otherwise unavailable, THEN THE system SHALL provide business-explained error messages to requesters ("Asset permanently unavailable. For dispute or refund provide alternate evidence.")
- IF repeat failures or malware triggers occur, THEN THE system SHALL blacklist file hash and/or source, lock user for review, and alert admin.
- IF a retention/archival error is detected, THEN THE system SHALL lock all affected files, prevent deletion, and notify compliance roles.
- IF an upload or download cannot complete within defined SLA due to system or 3rd-party error, THEN THE system SHALL queue and retry job, and present user/admin with ongoing status and remediation path.
- WHEN catastrophic/system data loss is detected (disaster recovery), THE system SHALL attempt automated fail-over to backup and log all recovery events; if unsuccessful, notify administrators for urgent intervention.
- IF an account is offboarded (user withdrawal, seller departure), THEN THE system SHALL lock all non-public files to access except to admin/compliance roles for mandated retention period, and trigger scheduled purging/anonymization.
- WHERE data privacy breach is detected (unauthorized access to sensitive files), THE system SHALL lock access, inform compliance roles, notify affected users, and maintain full incident log for audit.

## 9. Advanced Scenarios: Integrations, Policy, Extensibility
- WHEN third-party/partner system uploads assets (e.g., KYC proof, logistics photo), THE system SHALL validate according to business domain and trigger appropriate workflow (verification, evidence, contract proof).
- IF plugin/module (e.g., AI watermarking, evidence assessment) inserts/edits attachment data, THEN THE system SHALL log full context and maintain modifiability/auditability per process.
- WHEN admin imports data via API/bulk interface, THE system SHALL apply equivalent business validation, logging, and bulk failover as for direct roles.
- WHERE legal/policy changes trigger retention schedule revision, THE system SHALL apply updated policy to all relevant files from that point forward, retaining prior records per historical agreement.

## 10. Permission and Workflow Matrix by Domain
| Business Domain | Attachment Types Used                | Who Can Upload | Who Can View | Who Can Delete | Legal/Audit Retention | Key Business Rules                                                          |
|----------------|--------------------------------------|----------------|--------------|---------------|----------------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Products       | Product Images                       | Seller, Admin  | Seller, Admin| Seller, Admin  | Standard (2yrs)      | At least one image required before publish; history snapshot for edits        |
| Orders         | Invoices, Dispute Evidence           | Seller, Admin  | Seller, Admin| Admin          | Extended (5yrs)      | Invoices immutable after creation; evidence locked on dispute                 |
| Community      | Post/Review Media                    | Customer, Admin| Customer, Admin| Customer (own), Admin | Standard (2yrs)      | Evidence/media with reports kept until dispute closes                         |
| Compliance     | Seller Docs, KYC, Partner API Import | Seller, Admin, Partner| Admin       | Admin          | Regulatory (7yrs)     | Auto-revoke on role withdrawal, legal hold override, periodic verification    |
| Integrations   | Log/Evidence/Proof/Import            | Partner, Admin | Admin        | Admin          | Contractual           | Retention policy dictated by agreement; embargo on delete pre-expiry          |


## 11. Visual Workflow: File Lifecycle Diagram (Enhanced Mermaid)
```mermaid
graph LR
    subgraph "Upload & Validation"
        A["File Upload Request"] --> B{"Valid File Type/Size?"}
        B -->|"Yes"| C["Virus/Malware Scan"]
        B -->|"No"| D["Reject with Error Code"]
        C --> E{"Scan Passed?"}
        E -->|"Yes"| F["Assign Metadata & ID"]
        E -->|"No"| G["Block Upload & Escalate"]
        F --> H["Store in Proper Tier"]
    end
    H --> I{"CDN/Public Asset?"}
    I -->|"Yes"| J["Push to CDN & Cache"]
    I -->|"No"| K["Retain in Secure Tier"]
    J --> L["Update Access Controls"]
    K --> L
    L --> M{"Event: Access, Version, Delete?"}
    M -->|"Access"| N["Check ACL, Log Access"]
    M -->|"Version"| O["Snapshot, Relabel Latest"]
    M -->|"Delete"| P["Check Lock, Purge or Archive"]
    M -->|"Legal Hold"| Q["Freeze & Audit"]
    O --> L
    P --> L
    Q --> L
    L --> R{"Retention Expiry?"}
    R -->|"Yes"| S["Archive/Purge"]
    R -->|"No"| T["Retain/File Available"]
```

- [Product & Catalog Management Requirements](./04-product-and-catalog-management.md): Product image and catalog logic for asset use

## 13. Closing and Implementation Expectations
All requirements covered above define the binding business logic for file and attachment handling in shoppingMallAi. Backend development teams must enforce every rule and scenario consistently. No technical solution is mandated, but all system behaviors, permission checks, retention policies, audit trails, and user experience outcomes must be implemented to fulfill these specifications.
